serial_toolbox

GUI module

class serial_toolbox.gui.Application(interface, plotting: bool = True)

A Example tkinter application for serial communication.

interface

The interface to interact with the serial port.

Type:

serial_interface

left_frame

The Left Frame of the application.

Type:

CTkFrame

right_frame

The Right Frame of the application.

Type:

CTkFrame

entry_text

The String variable linked to the data entry.

Type:

CTkStringVar

data_entry

The entry field for the command.

Type:

CTkEntry

send_button

The button to send the command.

Type:

CTkButton

data_text

The textbox to display sent and received messages. Incoming data from the serial interface and the sent commands will be displayed in this field.

Type:

CTkText

figure

The Figure object for the plot in the right frame. This object is what actually contains the graphical representation of the data.

Type:

Figure

plot

The subplot in the figure. This is where the data from the serial interface gets plotted.

Type:

AxesSubplot

canvas

The canvas on which the figure is drawn. This is a tkinter-compatible canvas that the Figure object draws onto.

Type:

FigureCanvasTkAgg

rxd_update()

Update the plot with the data from the interface. This function re-plots the data from the serial interface, then schedules itself to be called again after 100 ms. This function is automatically triggered in the initialization of the Application class, implementing a regular update of the plot.

send_command()

Fetch the command, send it via the serial interface and update the textbox. Clear the command entry field after sending the command. This function is connected to the ‘Send’ button and the ‘Return’ key while typing into the data_entry field.

serial_toolbox.gui.serial_monitor_gui()

Start and run the customtkinter application. This is the main entry point of the application that creates an instance of the Application class and executes the main loop.
